intro: Huernia mccoyi, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and spiky, tubular flowers. The plant has a unique appearance with its green, ribbed stems and pale yellow to orange blooms. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves and stems. Huernia mccoyi is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
